Package com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model

Class AttackReport

java.lang.Object
com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model.AttackReport
public class AttackReport
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains two pieces of information, the first is a text-based description of how a character defended against an attack, the second is the actualDamage the character received, note that actualDamage could have a negative value indicating healing. Class Character uses this class as part of it's defend(Attack) method.
Author:
piedas
See Also:
Character

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int actualDamage
    Contains the damage received from an attack, can be a negative value (healing).
    private java.lang.String report
    Contains the report detailing the defense.

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    AttackReport()

    Sets the report and actualDamage to the respective fields.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getActualDamage()
    Gets the actual damage as part of this AttackReport, the returned value can be negative indicating healing.
    java.lang.String getReport()
    Gets the report for this object, can also return null
    void setActualDamage​(int actualDamage)
    Sets the actual damage value for this AttackReport, no data validation is performed.
    void setReport​(java.lang.String report)
    Sets the report for this object, does not perform any validation.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Overridden toString() returns a formatted message consisting of the report + " actual damage: " + actualDamage.

  • Constructor Details

    • AttackReport

      public AttackReport()
      Sets the report to "no report" and the actual damage to zero (i.e. 0).

    • AttackReport

      public AttackReport​(java.lang.String report, int actualDamage)
      Sets the report and actualDamage to the respective fields. Does not perform data validation.
      Parameters:
      report - the text data for this report
      actualDamage - the actual damage for this report

  • Method Details

    • getReport

      public java.lang.String getReport()
      Gets the report for this object, can also return null

      the report for this object, or null

    • setReport

      public void setReport​(java.lang.String report)
      Sets the report for this object, does not perform any validation.
      Parameters:
      report - the report for this object

    • getActualDamage

      public int getActualDamage()
      Gets the actual damage as part of this AttackReport, the returned value can be negative indicating healing.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overridden toString() returns a formatted message consisting of the report + " actual damage: " + actualDamage. Uses methods getReport() and getActualDamage()

      toString in class java.lang.Object
